review: Easy to setup and use! Plug in the device to your TV's HDMI, plug into power through either the enclosed power adapter or through a powered USB port, connect to WiFi and you are set. Display is awesome. We have a good WiFi connection so no buffering! If Sling TV is all it is cracked up to be and we can get a good digital antenna our cable company is out the door!This device is the perfect gift for those who can't afford cable, moving into dorms, etc. We are a single family home and it is perfect for us!
author: Kelly

review: If you are a heavy Netflix user, like we are, you may want to think twice before buying the FireTV Stick... or at least power it via AC (which, to be fair, Amazon recommends anyway).  It seems that when the FireTV Stick loses power, it does not retain your logon information for Netflix (this is not an issue for ANY of the other apps that I use that require logon)... so, if you are powering via USB port on your TV, this will happen every time you turn off your TV!  Evidently, Amazon sees retaining your logon credentials for Netflix as a "feature request" and not a bug (nevermind that this is a basic expectation of any app, that all other apps on the FireTV Stick seem to not have any issue with this and that every other device I use Netflix on does not have this issue).  This "feature request" has been open for some time.If you are okay with powering via AC (which would drastically reduce how often you'd need to enter Netflix credentials) or are not a heavy Netflix user, this device is a fantastic value.  Apps work well, interface with Amazon services is excellent (as you'd expect).  A cross-app search function would be welcomed, but otherwise very, very good device!
